result.execSummary:
The defendant Michelle A. Lyons was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manuf/Deliver Amphetamine(>50g) [Modifiers: Conspiracy to Commit], a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(e)4.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: NOTE:  The Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse program AFTER serving one (1) year of initial confinement.

superMiscConds.notes:
Pay court costs and Department of Corrections Supervision Fees. THE DEPARTMENT OF CORRECTIONS SHALL DEDUCT RESTITUTION AND ALL OTHER COURT OBLIGATIONS AT THE RATE OF 25% OF ALL MONIES RECEIVED WHILE INCARCERATED. 
-----------------------
Reimburse buy money to the Walworth County Drug Unit in the amount of $260.00 - joint and several with co-defendants.
-----------------------

No contact with anyone using, selling, or possessing a controlled substance. No contact with co-actors. No medication without a valid prescription. No alcohol. No controlled substances or paraphernalia.
-----------------------
Counseling as recommended by Probation Agent. Provide biological specimen to state crime lab for DNA analysis, and pay DNA analysis surcharge.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michelle A. Lyons

Defendant Michelle A. Lyons appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Donald L. Conner II in court for Michelle A. Lyons.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court by ADA Vivien TenHaken. Matter before the Court for plea and sentencing - **SEE ATTACHED MINUTE SHEET**

Defendant Michelle A. Lyons appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Donald L. Conner II in court for Michelle A. Lyons.  Prosecuting attorney Samuel Thomas Berg in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defense to check out additional discovery. Minutes filed.
Status conference scheduled for October 25, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

Defendant Michelle A. Lyons appeared by video, in custody.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court by JJ Crawford.  Attorney Donald L. Conner II in court for Michelle A. Lyons. Called @ 1:36 p.m. Appearances made. Matter before the Court for status hearing. REcord by Atty. Conner as to new discovery and lack of offer from the State. Asks for additional status. Matter set before assigned judge - Koss.
Status conference scheduled for August 25, 2022 at 08:30 am.

2:10PM Defendant Michelle A. Lyons appeared by video.  Attorney Donald L. Conner II in court for Michelle A. Lyons.  Attorney Andrew Herrmann in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Matter was scheduled for a preliminary hearing but the defendant wishes to waive her right to a preliminary hearing.  Response by Counsel and defendant to Court's questions.  Court finds defendant freely, knowingly and voluntarily waives her right to a preliminary hearing and binds the defendant over.
Attorney Conner acknowledged the Information, waived reading and plead not guilty to the charge on behalf of his client.

Bond Motion withdrawn by Attorney Conner.

Status conference scheduled for July 21, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Notice of Motion and Motion to Modify Bond

Prosecuting attorney Andrew Herrmann in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Michelle A. Lyons in court, in custody by video.  Attorney Donald L. Conner II in court for Michelle A. Lyons. Defendant given complaint; charges/penalties explained by the court. Preliminary hearing requested within time period. Attorney Just appointed yesterday - has not had time to meet with defendant. Court reads charges to defendant. Minutes filed.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 16, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Order for Representation - No Repayment Ordered at this Time
Proposed Order for Representation

Prosecuting attorney Vivien L. TenHaken in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Michelle A. Lyons in court, in custody by video. SPD has exhausted their efforts to appoint due to conflicts. Court appoints attorney. Minutes filed.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for May 10, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
OSPD Appointment of Counsel
Cash bond filed. Defendant refused to sign.
Original Warrant filed with the court.
Original Warrant filed with the court.

Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia. Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any co-actor(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  CO-ACTOR(S)/RESIDENCE(S): KENNETH CHADWICK, KRYSTAL GEHRKE, JILLIAN LEIGHTON, SEAN MASON, CHRISTOPHER MCFADDEN, JOSHUA POTTER, THOMAS SCHULTZ, FREDERICK TAYLOR, BRIAN TIDWELL & SHAUNA GONZALEZ GARZA. Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.

Case called 1:27 PM. Prosecuting attorney Vivien L. TenHaken in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Michelle A. Lyons in court, in custody by video. Attorney Tony Kim appeared for bond purposes only. Matter before the court is RWIN. State responds to court's question. Discussion as to bond. Record by Attorney Kim as to conflict. SPD will appoint new counsel. Bond set $25,000 cash. Minutes filed.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for May 4, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
